org.jcvi.jillion.sam

Class SamRecordFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.sam.SamRecordFlags

  • public class SamRecordFlags
extends Object
    Immutable Wrapper around bit flags set in a SAM/BAM file to show which SamRecordFlag values are present in this SamRecord. This class uses the flyweight pattern to save memory since most of the millions of reads in BAM file will have the same flag combinations. Several mutator methods in this class such as add(SamRecordFlag) and remove(SamRecordFlag) return new/different instances since these objects are immutable.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    Since:
    5.3

    • Method Detail

      • valueOf

        public static SamRecordFlags valueOf(int bits)
        Get the SamRecordFlags object for the given set bits as an int (as it is stored in BAM).
        Parameters:
        bits - the bit values for the set flag; will always be >=0.
        Returns:
        a SamRecordFlags object which may be the same reference as previously returned objects. Will never be null.

      • valueOf

        public static SamRecordFlags valueOf(BitSet bits)
        Get the SamRecordFlags object for the given set bits stored in a BitSet.
        Parameters:
        bits - the bit values for the set flag; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a SamRecordFlags object which may be the same reference as previously returned objects. Will never be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bits is null.

      • valueOf

        public static SamRecordFlags valueOf(Collection<SamRecordFlag> flags)
        Get the SamRecordFlags object for the given collection of SamRecordFlag objects.
        Parameters:
        flags - the SamRecordFlag objects to turn into a SamRecordFlags object.
        Returns:
        a SamRecordFlags object which may be the same reference as previously returned objects. Will never be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the collection is null or any value inside the collection is null.

        A different SamRecordFlags object than this since SamRecordFlags is immutable.

      • maybeReferenceSequence

        public boolean maybeReferenceSequence()
        Is this potentially a reference sequence.
        Returns:
        true if the bits == 516 as per the SAM spec.

      • isAnnotation

        public boolean isAnnotation()
        Is this record a dummy sequence where only the property annotations are used.
        Returns:
        true if flags is set to 768 as per the SAM spec.
